blocks.value: St. Maria Goretti was born in Italy in 1890. Her family was very poor, and her father died when she was young. At the age of 11, Maria was attacked by a young man named Alessandro Serenelli, who tried to rape her. Maria resisted, saying "No! It is a sin! God does not want it!" Alessandro stabbed her repeatedly.

As Maria lay dying, she forgave her attacker, saying she wanted to see him in heaven. Alessandro was imprisoned, and after eight years, he had a conversion and repented. After his release, he sought out Maria's mother and begged her forgiveness, which she gave. Alessandro attended Maria's canonization in 1950. St. Maria Goretti is the patron saint of youth, victims of rape, and purity.
